com.zendesk.sdk.util

Class CryptoUtils

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.zendesk.sdk.util.CryptoUtils

  • public class CryptoUtils
extends Object
    A collection of utility methods for performing encryption and decryption.

    • Method Summary

    • Method Detail

      • encrypt

        public static String encrypt(SecretKey secretKey,
             String cleartext)
        Encrypts text with the specified arguments and encodes the result in Base64.

        This method requires that you have generated a SecretKey, possibly by using generateKey(int, String). The cleartext will be encrypted with the algorithm specified in the SecretKey and then encoded in Base64 with the Base64.NO_WRAP flag set as an option. UTF-8 will be used as the character encoding for the string to byte array conversion.

        Parameters:
        secretKey - The SecretKey specifying the algorithm
        cleartext - Some clear text to encrypt using the specified SecretKey
        Returns:
        The Base64 encoded ciphertext string obtained by running the cleartext through the specified transformations.

      • decrypt

        public static String decrypt(SecretKey secretKey,
             String cipertext)
        Decrypts the given cipertext using the specified SecretKey.

        The cipertext is assumed to have been encoded in Base64 after it was encrypted. Therefore the ciphertext that you pass to this method will be base64 decoded before it is decrypted.

        Parameters:
        secretKey - The SecretKey specifying the algorithm
        cipertext - The Base64 encoded ciphertext to decrypt
        Returns:
        The cleartext string that is the result of the decryption

      • generateKey

        public static SecretKey generateKey(int keyLength,
                    String algorithm)
        Generates a cryptographic key.

        The algorithm will be a string representing an available algorithm within an available Provider. You can list all providers with Security.getProviders() and then list all algorithms for a provider by listing all of its services which will contain the name of the algorithm

        Parameters:
        keyLength - The length of the key to generate
        algorithm - The algorithm to use
        Returns:
        A SecretKey cryptographic key
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - if the key length is <= 0 or the algorithm is not specified
        NoSuchAlgorithmException - if the specified algorithm is not available on this runtime
